010package imagingbook.common.util;
011
012import java.util.Formatter;
013import java.util.Locale;
014
015import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
016
017/**
018 * This class provides some static methods for formatting Java arrays
019 * (representing vectors, matrices or measurements) for copy-pasting to
020 * Mathematica.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 * @version 2014/12/03
024 */
025public abstract class MathematicaIO {
026        
027        private MathematicaIO() {}
028
029        /**
030         * Generates a string holding the named definition of a 1D double array for
031         * Mathematica in the form name = {A[0], A[1], ...,A[m-1]};
032         * 
033         * @param name the identifier to be used in Mathematica.
034         * @param A    the array to be encoded (of length m).
035         * @return a String holding the Mathematica definition.
036         */
037        public static String listArray(String name, double[] A) {
038                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
039                Formatter formatter = new Formatter(sb, Locale.US);
040                String fs = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
041                formatter.format(name + " = {");
042                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
043                        if (i > 0)
044                                formatter.format(", ");
045                        formatter.format(fs, A[i]);
046                }
047                formatter.format("};\n");
048                String result = formatter.toString();
049                formatter.close();
050                return result;
051        }
052        
053        /**
054         * Generates a string holding the named definition of a 1D float array for
055         * Mathematica in the form {@code name = {A[0], A[1], ...,A[m-1]};}
056         * 
057         * @param name the name (Mathematica symbol) for the resulting array
058         * @param A    the array to be encoded (of length m).
059         * @return a String holding the Mathematica definition.
060         */
061        public static String listArray(String name, float[] A) {
062                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
063                Formatter formatter = new Formatter(sb, Locale.US);
064                String fs = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
065                formatter.format(name + " = {");
066                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
067                        if (i > 0)
068                                formatter.format(", ");
069                        formatter.format(fs, A[i]);
070                }
071                formatter.format("};\n");
072                String result = formatter.toString();
073                formatter.close();
074                return result;
075        }
076        
077        /**
078         * Generates a string holding the named definition of a 1D int array for
079         * Mathematica in the form {@code name = {A[0], A[1], ...,A[m-1]};}
080         * 
081         * @param name the name (Mathematica symbol) for the resulting array
082         * @param A    the array to be encoded (of length m).
083         * @return a String holding the Mathematica definition.
084         */
085        public static String listArray(String name, int[] A) {
086                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
087                Formatter formatter = new Formatter(sb, Locale.US);
088                formatter.format(name + " = {");
089                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
090                        if (i > 0)
091                                formatter.format(", ");
092                        formatter.format("%d", A[i]);
093                }
094                formatter.format("};\n");
095                String result = formatter.toString();
096                formatter.close();
097                return result;
098        }
099
100        // TODO: CHECK i/j indices!!!
101        /**
102         * Generates a string holding the named definition of a 2D double array for
103         * Mathematica in the form name = {{A[0][0],...,A[0][m-1]},
104         * {A[1][0],...,A[1][m-1]}, ..., {A[n-1][0], A[n-1][1], ...,A[n-1][m-1]}};
105         * 
106         * @param name the identifier to be used in Mathematica.
107         * @param A    the array to be encoded (of length m).
108         * @return a String holding the Mathematica definition.
109         */
110        public static String listArray(String name, double[][] A) {
111                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
112                Formatter formatter = new Formatter(sb, Locale.US);
113                String fs = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
114                formatter.format(name + " = {");
115                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
116                        if (i == 0)
117                                formatter.format("{");
118                        else
119                                formatter.format(", \n{");
120                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
121                                if (j == 0) 
122                                        formatter.format(fs, A[i][j]);
123                                else
124                                        formatter.format(", " + fs, A[i][j]);
125                        }
126                        formatter.format("}");
127                }
128                formatter.format("};\n");
129                String result = formatter.toString();
130                formatter.close();
131                return result;
132        }
133
134        /**
135         * Generates a string holding the named definition of a 2D float array for
136         * Mathematica in the form name = {{A[0][0],...,A[0][m-1]},
137         * {A[1][0],...,A[1][m-1]}, ..., {A[n-1][0], A[n-1][1], ...,A[n-1][m-1]}};
138         * 
139         * @param name the identifier to be used in Mathematica.
140         * @param A    the array to be encoded (of length m).
141         * @return a String holding the Mathematica definition.
142         */
143        public static String listArray(String name, float[][] A) {
144                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
145                Formatter formatter = new Formatter(sb, Locale.US);
146                String fs = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
147                formatter.format(name + " = {");
148                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
149                        if (i == 0)
150                                formatter.format("{");
151                        else
152                                formatter.format(", \n{");
153                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
154                                if (j == 0) 
155                                        formatter.format(fs, A[j][i]);
156                                else
157                                        formatter.format(", " + fs, A[j][i]);
158                        }
159                        formatter.format("}");
160                }
161                formatter.format("};\n");
162                String result = formatter.toString();
163                formatter.close();
164                return result;
165        }
166        
167// ------------------------------------------------------
168        
169//      public static void main(String[] args) {
170//              double[][] A = new double[10][2];
171//              for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
172//                      A[i][0] = i * 1.0/3 - 1.5;
173//                      A[i][1] = Math.random();
174//              }
175//              String str = listArray("A", A);
176//              System.out.println(str);
177//
178//      }
179
180}
